# Reference

## Table of Contents

**Classes**

* [`bash`](#bash): Install and configure bash
* [`bash::params`](#bashparams): Default parameter values

## Classes

### bash

Install and configure bash

#### Examples

##### Basic usage

```puppet
include bash
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `bash` class.

##### `bashpackage`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The name of the package to be installed

Default value: $bash::params::bashpackage

##### `bashcompletionpackage`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The name of the package that provides auto-completions for bash

Default value: $bash::params::bashcompletionpackage

##### `bashpath`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

The path to the bash binary once installed

Default value: $bash::params::bashpath

##### `root_home`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

The path to root's home directory

Default value: $bash::params::root_home

##### `ensure`

Data type: `Any`

This value is passed directly to the package resouce for $bashpackage.
See here for valid values:
https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/latest/types/package.html#package-attribute-ensure

Default value: latest

### bash::params

Default parameter values
